availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, tinner, 1st Lieutenant, 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry. Kentucky native. Son of Felix and Mary King. Married to Pamelia Nichols on December 3, 1863. Father of Margaret E. King, William M. King, Lue King, and Kate King. Tinner in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Mustered into service on October 3, 1861, for three years. Named 1st Lieutenant of Company F, 17th KY Volunteer Infantry on June 26, 1862. Resigned from service January 31, 1863.

ab.bibl: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McClean County, p. 207. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 303. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Muhlenberg County, KY, July 1863, p. 24, (Accessed via ancestry.com). Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 173-1965. Madison County Courthouse, RIchmond, Kentucky, (Accessed via Ancestry.com). Find A Grave, "William T. King (1841-1904)," Memorial #74908424, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74908424/william-t.-king (accessed May 14, 2018).
